title: Toleration
summary: Toleration is the allowing, permitting, or acceptance of an action, idea, object, or person which one dislikes or disagrees with.  Political scientist Andrew R. Murphy explains that "We can improve our understanding by defining "toleration" as a set of social or political practices and "tolerance" as a set of attitudes.".[1] Random House Dictionary defines tolerance as "a fair, objective, and permissive attitude toward those whose opinions, beliefs, practices, racial or ethnic origins, etc., differ from one's own".[2]
